sailpoint.object

Class Schema

  • java.lang.Object
    • sailpoint.tools.xml.AbstractXmlObject
      • sailpoint.object.SailPointObject
        • sailpoint.object.Schema
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, sailpoint.tools.xml.PersistentXmlObject, sailpoint.tools.xml.XMLReferenceTarget

    public class Schema
extends SailPointObject
    Class used to describe each object type supported by an application.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Schema

        public Schema(java.lang.String objectType,
              java.lang.String nativeType)
        Constructs a Schema object from a objectType and nativeType.

        Parameters:
        objectType - The type of this object, for example, USer, Group, Permission
        nativeType - The application specific name of the this schema. For example, inetOrgPerson

      • Schema

        public Schema(java.lang.String objectType,
              java.lang.String nativeType,
              java.util.List<AttributeDefinition> attrList)
        Constructs a Schema object from a objectType, nativeType and the list of AttributeDefinitions for this schema.

        Parameters:
        objectType - The type of this object, for example, USer, Group, Permission
        nativeType - The application specific name of the this schema. For example, inetOrgPerson
        attrList - List of AttributeDefinitions

    • Method Detail

      • isAggregationType

        public static boolean isAggregationType(java.lang.String type)
        Return true if an object type is one of our standard aggregation types. Used to control the rendering of the aggregation type selector when defining new schemas.

      • isNameUnique

        public boolean isNameUnique()
        These can have names but they are optional and non-unique.
        Overrides:
        isNameUnique in class SailPointObject

      • getObjectType

        public java.lang.String getObjectType()
        The type of object the schema is defining. Examples are: Account, Group, and Permission.

      • setObjectType

        public void setObjectType(java.lang.String objectType)
        Sets the schema type.

      • getAggregationType

        public java.lang.String getAggregationType()
        The type of IIQ object that will be created when objects of this schema are aggregated: account, group, or alert. May be null if _objectType uses those names. Set only if an application has more than one schema that aggregates the same type.

      • setAggregationType

        public void setAggregationType(java.lang.String type)
        Sets the aggregation type.

      • setNativeObjectType

        public void setNativeObjectType(java.lang.String nativeType)
        Sets the native object type. For example "iNetOrgPerson".

      • setDisplayAttribute

        public void setDisplayAttribute(java.lang.String attributeName)

        displayName in LDAP

        samAccountName in AD

        @Deprecated
public java.lang.String getGroupAttribute()
        Deprecated. see Schema.getGroupAttribute(String)
        The name of the attribute in the account schema whose values will be the ids of objects defined by this schema. Typical values will be "groups" and "memberOf".

      • isChildHierarchy

        public boolean isChildHierarchy()
        When false indiciates that the values in the _hiearchyAttribute represent parent objects, or objects from which we will inherit things.

        When true indiciates that the _hierarchyAttribute contains child objects, or objects that will inherit things from us.

      • getAttributeBySource

        public AttributeDefinition getAttributeBySource(java.lang.String sourceApp,
                                                java.lang.String sourceAttr)
        Return the attribute in this schema that has the given source. This will return an attribute on a logical application if the source information matches what is returned by the getCompositeSourceXXX() methods.
        Parameters:
        sourceApp - The name of the source application.
        sourceAttr - The name of the attribute on the source application.
        Returns:
        The attribute in this schema that has the given source, or null if none is found.

        Returns the type (String, Long, List, etc) of the specified attribute.

        Parameters:
        attributeName - Case sensitive attributename

      • isRequired

        public boolean isRequired(java.lang.String attributeName)
        Returns the isRequired flag for the specified attribute.

        Parameters:
        attributeName - Case sensitive attributename

        This method will return false if the isRequired flag is not set or if the attribute is not defined for this schema.

      • isMultiValued

        public boolean isMultiValued(java.lang.String attributeName)
        Returns the isMultiValued flag for the specified attribute.

        Parameters:
        attributeName - Case sensitive attributename

        This method will return false if the isMultiValued flag is not set or if the attribute is not defined for this schema.

      • getDefaultValue

        public java.lang.Object getDefaultValue(java.lang.String attributeName)
        Returns the default value of the specified attribute.

        Parameters:
        attributeName - Case sensitive attributename

        This method will return null if there is not a default value specified or if the attribute is not defined for this schema.

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription(java.lang.String attributeName)
        Returns the description of the specified attribute.

        Parameters:
        attributeName - Case sensitive attributename

        This method will return null if there is not a description specified, or if the attribute is not defined for this schema.

      • initCorrelationKeys

        public void initCorrelationKeys()
        Set the correlationKeyAssigned property for each attribute in this schema that has an assigned correlation key. This is a transient field used only while the schema is being edited in the UI.

      • assignCorrelationKeys

        public boolean assignCorrelationKeys(int maximum)
        Called from the UI when editing of the schema is complete. Reorganize the correlation keys. Returns false if the number of keys to assign exceeds the given maximum. In this case no changes will have been made to the key assignments.

      • setFeaturesString

        public void setFeaturesString(java.lang.String features)
        Set the features for this schema using a CSV string. This sets the feature list using a list of Feature names.
        See Also:
        Schema.setFeatures(List)

      • getFeaturesString

        public java.lang.String getFeaturesString()
        Sets the Feature list for this schema. Using a CSV list.

      • getFeatures

        public java.util.List<Application.Feature> getFeatures()
        Returns a list of Features supported by this schema.

      • setFeatures

        public void setFeatures(java.util.List<Application.Feature> features)
        Sets the Features that are supported by this schema.

      • addFeature

        public void addFeature(Application.Feature feature)

      • supportsFeature

        public boolean supportsFeature(Application.Feature feature)
        Returns true if the given Feature is supported on this schema.

      • removeFeature

        public boolean removeFeature(Application.Feature feature)
        Removes a feature from this Schema.
        Parameters:
        feature - Feature to be removed from the Schema, if present
        Returns:
        true if the Schema supported the Feature

      • getIncludePermissions

        public boolean getIncludePermissions()
        Flag that indicates to the applications where supported should return a list of Permission objects in the attribute list as an attribute named "directPermissions".

      • includePermissions

        public boolean includePermissions()

      • setIncludePermissions

        public void setIncludePermissions(boolean includePermissions)

      • isIndexPermissions

        public boolean isIndexPermissions()
        Flag that indicates that permissions should be indexed for effective access search.

      • setIndexPermissions

        public void setIndexPermissions(boolean b)

      • isNoPermissionPromotion

        public boolean isNoPermissionPromotion()
        Flag that when set, disables the promotion of Permission objects found in this schema to ManagedAttribute objects for display in the entitlement catalog. This might be set if the Permission model uses complex rights and annotations and does not need the overhead of promoting ManagedAttributes for the targets.

      • setNoPermissionPromotion

        public void setNoPermissionPromotion(boolean b)

        public boolean isPermissionRemediationModifiable()
        Return whether permissions on from this schema can be modified in a remediation request.

      • hasIndexedAttribute

        public boolean hasIndexedAttribute()
        Return true if there is at least one indexed attribute.

      • hasDirectPermissions

        public boolean hasDirectPermissions()
        Return true if this application can return direct permissions. Note that this is a combination of two things, the feature says that it is possible in the connector, and a flag that says whether to actually do it.

      • isGroupAggregation

        public boolean isGroupAggregation()
        Return true if this is considered to be a "group" schema that will aggregate into a ManagedAttribute. This is more complicated than the other aggregation types for backward compatibility.

        In the usual case _objectType will be "group". In a very few number of connectors there can be more than one group type, SAP-Direct is one where the group schemas are named "role" and "profile".

        For backward compatibility if aggregationType is not set, it will be assumed to be "group".

      • isGroupAggregation

        public static boolean isGroupAggregation(java.lang.String objectType,
                                         java.lang.String aggregationType)

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Description copied from class: SailPointObject
        We override equals so that two objects will compare equal if they have the same database id or unique name, but are different Java objects. This is necessary for Hibernate because caches commonly have to be cleared or objects from one session need to be used to match things loaded in a different session.
        Overrides:
        equals in class SailPointObject
